content: Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), also known as drones, are powered aerial vehicles that do not carry a human operator. They can fly autonomously or be piloted remotely, and can carry a lethal or nonlethal payload. UAVs are either single air vehicles or part of a UAV system (UAS) consisting of multiple air vehicles, a ground control station, and support equipment.
